title: Arianespace wins Vega contract for Italian imaging satellite constellation
summary: In a vote of confidence for a troubled launch vehicle, Arianespace won a contract from the Italian government for up to three Vega C launches of an Earth observation constellation.

title: China launches second classified Gaofen-13 remote sensing satellite
summary: China added its initially civilian Gaofen Earth observation series Friday with the launch of the classified optical geostationary Gaofen-13 (02) satellite.

title: Electron launches two Capella Space radar satellites
summary: Rocket Lab launched its second Electron rocket from Virginia March 16, placing two Capella Space radar imaging satellites into orbit.

title: NASA selects Axiom Space for third private astronaut mission to ISS
summary: NASA has approved plans by Axiom Space to fly a third private astronaut mission to the International Space Station as soon as November, although with no details yet about who will go on the flight.

title: DoD seeking seamless military-commercial satellite communications
summary: Companies in the satcom industry  are trying to support DoD’s vision of a seamless military-commercial architecture.

title: Rocket Lab launches pair of Capella satellites from Wallops
summary: Rocket Lab, which opened its 2023 campaign with the inauguration of its first US-based launch pad, has launched its second consecutive mission from Launch Complex 2 at NASA’s Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia. Liftoff of the “Stronger Together” mission occurred 38 minutes into the two-hour window, with T0 at 6:38 PM EDT (22:38 UTC) on Thursday, March 16.

title: Astra Requests NASDAQ Extension, Considers Reverse Stock Split To Avoid Delisting
summary: Astra has submitted an application to Nasdaq for an additional 180-day period to comply with the minimum bid price requirement.

title: Astra outlines its plan to avoid Nasdaq delisting, including possible reverse stock split
summary: Spacecraft engine manufacturer and small rocket builder Astra on Thursday outlined a plan to avoid having its stock delisted from the Nasdaq.

title: NASA Selects 21 New Learning Projects to Engage Students in STEM
summary: NASA is awarding more than $3.8 million to 21 museums, science centers, and other informal education institutions for projects designed to bring the excitement of space science to communities across the nation and broaden student participation in STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics).

title: NASA AIM Earth Orbiter Mission Ends Following Battery Issues
summary: After more than 15 years of operation, NASA’s Aeronomy of Ice in the Mesosphere (AIM) spacecraft has ceased operations due to battery issues.
